summary: This is a U.S. Attorney's Office press release announcing the arrest and indictment of Ghislaine Maxwell on charges of conspiring with Jeffrey Epstein to sexually abuse minors, and for perjury in connection with 2016 depositions. It details the allegations of grooming and abuse spanning from 1994 to 1997 across multiple locations.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Arrested and charged with enticing and transporting minors for illegal sex acts, conspiracy, and perjury for her alleged role in facilitating Jeffrey Epstein's abuse of minor girls.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Named as Maxwell's co-conspirator in a scheme to sexually abuse minor girls, with a stated preference for young girls. The abuse is alleged to have occurred at his residences.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.role: Acting United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York
persons.context: Announced the charges against Maxwell and made a statement detailing Maxwell's alleged role in grooming and delivering victims to Epstein.

persons.name: William F. Sweeney Jr.
persons.role: Assistant Director-in-Charge of the FBI's New York Field Office
persons.context: Announced the charges and made a statement commending the victims for their bravery and perseverance.

persons.name: Dermot Shea
persons.role: Commissioner of the New York City Police Department (NYPD)
persons.context: Announced the charges and commended investigators for their commitment to bringing justice to survivors of sexual assault.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The judge to whom Maxwell's case is assigned.

connections.description: Alleged to have conspired together from at least 1994 to 1997 to recruit, groom, and sexually abuse minor girls.
Maxwell is alleged to have facilitated, aided, and participated in Epstein's sexual abuse of minors, and was sometimes present for the abuse.

events.title: Arrest of Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell was arrested in the morning and charged with multiple federal crimes related to the sexual abuse of minors with Jeffrey Epstein and perjury.

events.title: Period of Alleged Abuse Conspiracy
events.description: The indictment alleges Maxwell and Epstein exploited girls as young as 14, enticing them to travel for illegal sex acts during this period.

events.title: Maxwell's False Deposition Testimony
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell is charged with perjury for making several false statements under oath during depositions in a civil proceeding.

locations: New Hampshire (where Maxwell was to be presented in court)
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell was arrested and charged on July 2, 2020, for conspiring with Jeffrey Epstein to sexually abuse minors and for perjury.
The indictment alleges Maxwell played a critical role in grooming minor victims as young as 14 from at least 1994 to 1997, befriending them and delivering them to Epstein for abuse.
Abuse allegedly occurred at Epstein's residences in New York, Florida, and New Mexico, as well as at Maxwell's London residence.
Maxwell is charged with two perjury counts related to false statements made under oath during 2016 depositions in a civil proceeding.
The press release includes statements from top law enforcement officials praising the victims' bravery and the investigative work of the FBI and NYPD.
